p.span: Simple Physical Simulator (SPS)

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt;

span.style: font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: About:

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600;

p.span: Simple Physical Simulator program allows you to stimulate
simple physical models that employ Newton's gravitational Force and Coulomb's Force. The simulation is monitored by a camera.
In a particular case, the program solves the problem of N bodies.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:12pt;

p.span: Model - Euclidean space associated with the Cartesian coordinate system, containing various objects.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:12pt;

p.span: An object is a Circle with charge mass, color, and optional radius.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:12pt;

p.span: Camera - Allows you to observe what is happening on the inside of the simulation in its field of vision. Can be scaled with the mouse wheel and moved with the mouse movements with the left button pressed.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:10pt;

span.style: font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: Options:

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600;

p.span: The program allows you to perform many manipulations on the model, and the simulation can be both stopped and started. Here are the most basic of them (for a complete list with a detailed description,
see model Management
top panel Buttons

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:10pt;

p.span: Adding objects
Deleting objects
Make the camera position the center of coordinates
Make the speed of the selected object world speed
Monitor/do Not monitor the selected object
To set the point of no return

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:10pt;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:10pt;

span.style: font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: Assignment:

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600;

p.span: The main purpose of the program - to conduct experiments of limited accuracy with the force of gravity and the force of the pendant; increasing interest in students undergoing training in physics by visual and interactive demonstration of some physical processes.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:10pt;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:10pt;

span.style: font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: Actual version(1.1):

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600;

p.span: This is a stable beta version of the program. At the moment, the program does not implement the full range of initially laid features, as some aspects of the program require improvement and are in the experimental stage (Elastic and Inelastic collision, deltaTime).

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-family:'MS Shell Dlg 2'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:600;
